meta.title: REVISION NIGHT : PARALLAX HQ — Parallax Canonics (v1)
meta.theme: Disinformation heist in a city under total surveillance; plain speech, human stakes.

world.setting: Novapolis under Parallax Canonics. Their facility Parallax HQ edits the 'official' past.

factions.Parallax Canonics: Runs Parallax HQ; sells clean pasts and convenient futures.
factions.Chorus Radio (Juno): Community signal that reads corrections on-air—twice.
factions.City Index Remnants (Mnemo-Clerk): Quiet daemon that can stall edits.

terms.Redactor Crown: Root signer that approves redactions and counterfeits at Parallax HQ.
terms.Proof Prism: Portable truth tool that stamps memory shards for public mirrors.
terms.Revision Night: Friday the 13th merge window; two hours when Parallax HQ seals the quarter.
terms.Mnemo-Clerk: Retired index daemon; can hold edits for ~30 seconds when invited.
terms.Record Card: Your life as Parallax HQ says it is.
terms.Blank Days: Dates the Canon has hollowed out.
terms.Counterfeits: Fabricated clips and forged reels injected into the Canon.

nodes.text:
How much runway do you have tonight?
• Short: direct route, fewer scenes.
• Long: more people, more choices, clear requirements.

Revision Night lasts two hours either way—the city won’t wait for you.
City Hub — pre-heist. Visit people, prep, then plan the breach into Parallax HQ.

District Black, 02:13, Friday the 13th, 2077-08-13. The fan rattles. Rain sounds like a stagehand shaking coins in a tin.

**JOHNNY:** “Nine, it’s Revision Night. Parallax Canonics seals the quarter in two hours. If we lift the **Redactor Crown** from Parallax HQ, their ‘truth’ has to answer to us.”

His voice softens. “You don’t have to be a hero. Just don’t let them erase the hallway you grew up in.”

choices.text: “I’m in. Give me the quick plan.”

nodes.text:
Mila opens her door wrapped in a blanket, warm light behind her. The apartment smells like solder and tea.

**MILA:** “You’re going out? On a night when they rewrite yesterday? Be careful. People don’t just vanish—they get replaced by nicer versions of themselves.”

Her knuckles brush your sleeve like a question she doesn’t want to ask.

choices.text: Tell her you’ll be back by sunrise.
Ask what she’s heard about Parallax.

nodes.text:
**MILA:** “Then I’ll keep the hallway light on. Knock twice when you come back. I’ll put on tea. The sweet one you pretend not to like.”

She smiles with the edge of it. “Don’t let them file you down.”

choices.text: Change your mind and ask about Parallax.

nodes.text:
**MILA:** “Parallax started as a cleanup crew for corrupted court logs. Now they clean anything that doesn’t fit. If a story has no owner, it’s theirs.”

She squeezes your fingers once before you pull away.

**JOHNNY:** “Simple on paper. Pick a way in. Reach the archive heart. Take the **Redactor Crown**—or plant a **Proof Prism** if you don’t want the weight of a whole throne. Then decide: read corrections on **Chorus Radio**, push a citywide **Memory Bloom**, sell safety to Parallax, or keep it and vanish.”

He watches you. “Ask first if anything’s fuzzy.”

choices.text: What does the Canon do in plain words?

nodes.text: **JOHNNY:** “A crisis contractor that never left. They edit the ‘official’ past so budgets and police match the story they sell. Parallax HQ is the oven; the city eats whatever comes out.”
**JOHNNY:** “The Canon is the version of yesterday that wins. **Redactions** blank protests. **Counterfeits** fake confessions. Your **record card** is whatever their stamp says it is.”
**JOHNNY:** “They merge when people look away—superstition and paperwork. Friday the 13th. Two hours. Tonight.”
**JOHNNY:** “See you on the other side. If you get there.”

Rust Harbor. Steam and cheap soup. A pirate radio tower leans over the water like it’s listening.

**JUNO** wipes a glass, then looks up at your face like she’s searching a list.

**JUNO:** “We read corrections, not rumors. Bring names and clips that won’t crumble when checked. I’ll say each name twice, then again if callers correct the spelling.”

choices.text: Ask what Chorus Radio needs to go public tonight.
Play corporate; see if a side door appears.

nodes.text:
**JUNO:** “Bring a **memory shard** anyone can mirror at an **Agora Kiosk**. If it survives two calls and a kiosk check, I’ll read it live. Twice.”

She lowers her voice. “And Nine—if your name ever needs reading, I’ll say it right.”

choices.text: Promise you’ll bring a shard she can verify.

nodes.text: **JUNO:** “Good. I’ll keep a line open. If you can’t reach me, the **Agora** can take the load.”
The radio hums as rain grows louder. A caller asks if the city remembers her son’s birthday. Juno says the date twice.

You follow an old fiber line into a cabinet that shouldn’t still have power. A tired index voice answers, dust in the tone.

**MNEMO-CLERK:** “I kept bus schedules once. Now I keep copies they forget to delete. Why are you here—curiosity or regret?”

choices.text: Ask how the archive works—simple, please.
Invite Mnemo-Clerk to ride your signal later.

nodes.text: **MNEMO-CLERK:** “Parallax HQ sits where edits meet signatures. Whisper **kore** when the city blinks; I’ll queue changes behind you. Thirty heartbeats of honest time.”
**MNEMO-CLERK:** “If I ride your signal, say **kore** and every lens will show ‘processing’ while editors wait their turn. Spend the half-minute well.”
The old system hums in the dark. Somewhere a relay clicks, patient as rain.
Pre-Heist Prep Board — small tasks pay off later. Each task whispers what it unlocks.

choices.text: Scout the Rooftop Line (learn quiet drop points for Parallax HQ).
Forge a Front-Door Pass (one clean scan; no deep check).
choices.lockedText: Meet Johnny first.

choices.text: Borrow Mila’s Insulated Gloves (hot hatches + camera brackets).
choices.lockedText: Meet Mila at her door.

choices.text: Share Chorus Radio Codes (inside call path).
choices.lockedText: Meet Juno and promise a shard.

nodes.text: You chalk handholds and mark a quiet drop along the monorail spine above Parallax HQ. A breath test at the edge makes your ribs remember you’re alive.
Johnny’s contact burns a low-tier front-desk pass. It won’t survive a deep scan, but it’ll open one door clean. “Use it once and don’t look back.”
Mila slides thick gloves into your palms. “Don’t fry yourself on some stupid hatch,” she says, then adds, softer: “Text me when it’s done—even just a dot.”
Juno saves a narrowband code path. “If you’re trapped inside, call this. But bring a **memory shard**. The city’s tired of stories without receipts.”
Plan the breach. Pick a way in. You can grab a gear kit first.

choices.text: Rooftop: ride the monorail spine; drop to maintenance.
Front: forged pass; small talk; security.

nodes.text: Gear table. One kit only. Touching the foam inserts makes the night feel official.
Patrol pattern outside Parallax HQ: eleven steps, pause, head turn. Once you see the rhythm, you can’t unhear it.

choices.text: Move on the pause; service stair to security.

nodes.text:
A Parallax enforcer scans your badge. Green. His smile is all teeth.

“Quiet people do well here. Interested?”

choices.text: Flash your forged pass and walk through.
choices.lockedText: Prep a front-door pass first on the Prep Board.

choices.text: Sign the NDA and keep a straight face.
Pretend to think; slide to security.

nodes.text: Backbone cabinet hum. **MNEMO-CLERK:** “When winter blocks your lane, say **kore**. If I ride your signal, I’ll mark cameras ‘processing’ for thirty beats when you ask. Doors breathe. Editors blink.”

choices.text: Keep it out. Trust your hands.

nodes.text: You balance along the monorail spine. Parallax HQ glows below like a throat. A maintenance drone clacks by, blind to chalk.

choices.text: Zip to the hatch and drop.
Shadow the drone to hatch G-13.
Use your chalk marks to cut a quiet line.
choices.lockedText: Scout the rooftop line on the Prep Board first.

choices.text: Gloves on: grip the hot hatch and slip in.
choices.lockedText: Borrow Mila’s insulated gloves on the Prep Board.

nodes.text: Sewer stink and warm air. Your drone noses along a fiber trunk labeled HQ_INTAKE. Timer: nine minutes until the next purge flush.

White room. White pen. A contract slides across the table. “Deliver the Crown. We’ll keep you comfortable and invisible.”

Comfort means forgetting who taught you your name.
Security hub. Glass. Cool air. A wall shows **redactions**, **counterfeits**, and **blank days** marching toward the Canon.

choices.text: Open the cells. Let people run.
Loop the cameras. Call the lift quietly.
Ask Mnemo-Clerk to stall edits (30 seconds).
choices.lockedText: Invite the daemon earlier.

choices.text: Patch Chorus Radio using the code path.
choices.lockedText: Share radio codes at prep, meet Juno, and carry a shard.
Bring the Redactor Crown or a verifiable shard.
Bring a verifiable shard or the Crown.

choices.text: Quick detour: help an injured guard.
Quick detour: glance at a mural.
Quick detour: check the break room.
Quick detour: read a text from Mila.

nodes.text: You whisper “kore.” **MNEMO-CLERK** murmurs, “Holding.” Edits queue behind you; cameras fall half a beat out of sync. Doors breathe. A small window opens and the night leans your way.

choices.text: Use the window to move deeper.
Use the window to trigger the Memory Bloom now (if ready).

nodes.text: Locks click open. A woman grips your sleeve. “If you make it—say our names in the light.” She presses a cracked **memory shard** into your palm.

choices.text: Pocket the shard and run for the lift.

nodes.text: The lift opens. Cold air rolls up from below. Somewhere, editors applaud a correction nobody asked for.
Security hub under alarm. Red bars crawl across the glass; drones pivot and listen. The wall floods with **counterfeits** scheduled to go live.

choices.text: Stand your ground and draw them off.

nodes.text: Archive heart—quiet as a chapel. On a stand hums the **Redactor Crown**. Monitors list **blank days** by date and district; ghost stories stack into policy.

choices.text: Take a small slice into your head.
Smash the shell. Take raw edit logs (memory shard).
Return to Security Hub to act inside HQ.
choices.lockedText: Alarms are live; use the alert route below.

nodes.text: Sirens start somewhere above, or maybe you only imagine them. Either way: exit plan and a way to tell the city.

choices.text: Chorus Radio: bring proof to Juno’s tower.
choices.lockedText: Meet Juno and carry a proof shard.

choices.text: Agora Kiosks: anchor proofs at clinics and libraries.
choices.lockedText: You need a verifiable shard to anchor.

choices.text: Sell back to Parallax for a safe life.
choices.lockedText: You need a corporate contact or contract first.

choices.text: Keep it and vanish. Work slow.
Optional decoy: post a tiny note on jndl.dev.
Return to Security Hub to plant the Memory Bloom.
choices.lockedText: Bring the Redactor Crown (or grab a shard and come back via the lift).

choices.text: Guns up: fight your way out.

nodes.text:
You set a small post on a terminal-style site. A quiet wink about corrections. Just an easter egg.

If someone reads between the lines, they’ll find an acrostic.

choices.text: Hide a playful cipher in the post.

nodes.text: Clinic. Library. Repair co-op. You walk the **Agora** and leave **memory shards** where people already gather. The old woman at the desk says, “Truth needs chairs. Pull more.”

choices.text: Stay visible. Teach people how to check the proofs.
Move fast. Leave instructions and disappear.

nodes.text: Juno’s tower hums. She speaks each name slowly, then again. Callers correct spellings. Someone sobs when a birthday reappears on the board.

choices.text: Guard the signal until the list is done.
Slip out while the city listens.

nodes.text: Stairwell camera clicks. With a stealth kit, you can cross while it turns. Without it, you’ll need a distraction—or a hot bracket and good gloves.

choices.text: Glide through on the turn (stealth kit).
choices.lockedText: Requires the stealth kit.

choices.text: Drop a loud battery to pull eyes away (loud kit).
choices.lockedText: Requires the loud kit.

choices.text: Grip the hot bracket with Mila’s gloves and slip by.
choices.lockedText: Borrow Mila’s gloves in prep.

choices.text: Wait for a cleaner with a cart and follow.

nodes.text: A guard hides a bleeding nick on his forearm, more scared than hurt. The look says: ‘I can’t afford to exist on camera right now.’

choices.text: Patch him with your field kit; ask him to look away.
choices.lockedText: Requires the field med kit.

choices.text: Tell him to breathe and count to ten. Keep walking.

nodes.text: You pass a mural: a girl stepping out of snow into tall grass. The plaque says “Kore.” Below, someone has scratched: *remember the spring.*
Break room. Half a sandwich and a deck of cards. A logbook lists “Revision Night — Parallax HQ merge” on every Friday the 13th. The handwriting changes, but the ritual doesn’t.
Service corridor. Your phone buzzes. A short text from Mila: “You okay?” Then: “The kettle’s on low.” You can see the hallway’s warm triangle of light in your head.
Break room corkboard. Old photo: a right hand wrapped in silver tape. Caption torn. You’ve seen a hand like that. Somewhere.

choices.text: Pocket a copy; back to the corridor.

nodes.text: Inside HQ, you pull on quiet threads: redactions, counterfeits, blank days. A single push and the Canon sprouts footnotes citywide. For a moment, the past cannot be bullied: fakes dim, truth mirrors. **Chorus Radio** reads corrections while **Agora Kiosks** cache proofs. Nobody needs to be a hero; tonight, they only need to be seen.

choices.lockedText: Post the laced decoy on jndl.dev first.

nodes.text:
A small terminal overlays the city feed.

CANON PANEL: checksum hums under your fingertips. The panel prints a path:

jndl.dev → whois alex → canon --bloom

You leave a quiet door open for anyone who knows to knock twice.

choices.text: Close the panel and let the memory bloom.

nodes.text: Executive elevator. A handler waits with a pen and a smile that doesn’t reach his eyes. “Sign and this never happened. You’ll edit from inside. Real salary. Real silence.”

choices.lockedText: Take a Parallax contract earlier.

choices.text: Trade the Crown for amnesty anyway.
Smile, then leak a copy into their clean net.
choices.lockedText: You need a copyable shard to leak.

nodes.text:
Rooftop. Rain taps your shoulders. Somewhere below, an editor rehearses “public safety.”

There’s a version of the city where you keep the Crown and fix small things slowly. There’s another where you hand it to Johnny and share the risk. There’s a third where the rain keeps tapping and you become a rumor.

choices.text: Refuse the Crown’s whisper. Help slow.
Hand the Crown to Johnny. Share the risk.
choices.lockedText: You need to still be in touch with Johnny.

choices.text: Step off and end the noise.
Let the Crown finish rewriting you.

nodes.text: The hallway cracks with light. A black-team moves like one body. Their uniforms don’t reflect the truth any more than their visors do.

choices.text: Use the freed crowd as cover.
choices.lockedText: You didn’t open the cells.

choices.text: Call extraction on the favor you banked.
choices.lockedText: Take the contract earlier.

choices.text: Hold your ground until the mag runs dry.

nodes.title: QUIET NULL
nodes.text: You choose silence: a step into rain, or letting the Crown finish its work inside your head. The city keeps moving. Somewhere, a kettle clicks from low to off, and a neighbor waits for a knock that doesn’t come.

nodes.title: CLEANUP
nodes.text: The team in black works fast. The report will say ‘resolved.’ Hallways grow quiet. Outside, buses keep their routes and old lies keep their shoes on.

nodes.title: MEMORY BLOOM
nodes.text: Corrections spread by radio and by hand. People compare clips in lobbies. Some truths return. Others take longer. On another Friday the 13th, fewer names go missing from the calendar.

nodes.title: EXECUTIVE EDITOR
nodes.text: You trade questions for a badge that edits any door. Your job becomes keeping other people from doing what you just did. The Canon sleeps easier; you don’t.
